abstract.text: A configuration that enables interaction between iPhone and third-party accessories.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use this class to interact with a third-party accessory that you partner with or develop.
For an example app that demonstrates this configuration, see

content.text: Discover the accessory and create a configuration

inlineContent.text: To begin the interaction, your app discovers the nearby accessory using a technology you choose — like
, the local network, or a secure internet connection — and establishes a two-way data link.
Over the data link, the accessory sends your app configuration data for this property’s
initializer. The accessory formats the data according to the

content.text: Enable background interaction for Bluetooth accessories

inlineContent.text: In iOS 16, third-party UWB accessories paired to the device through Bluetooth can interact with your app while it’s in the background. This enables a new class of hands-free experiences. For example, the user’s phone can be in their pocket and prompt an eBike to power on when mounted, or prompt lights to turn on and music to play as the user enters a room.
To enable background interaction:
The accessory implements the Bluetooth requirements described in the
The app connects and pairs to the accessory using
The app calls the
initializer and passes in the accessory’s Bluetooth identifier.

content.text: Start a session and share configuration data

inlineContent.text: To start a session, the app creates an
instance and passes an instance of this class into the session’s
function. After your app sets the session
, the system invokes the delegate’s
callback and provides your device’s configuration data.

Over the data link, your app sends your device’s configuration data to the accessory, which enables the two devices to start receiving location updates. When the system gathers location updates for the accessory, Nearby Interaction calls your delegate’s
implementation. To match
updates that your app receives through
with the accessory, compare the argument object’s discovery token with the value of this property’s

content.text: Enable Precision Finding for stationary objects

inlineContent.text: In iOS 16, you can combine the visual-spatial power of ARKit with the radio sensitivity of the Ultra Wideband (UWB) chip to locate stationary nearby objects with considerable precision. To do that, set
to
and optionally provide the interaction session with an
instance through
before running the session. Together, the UWB chip and ARKit’s assistance enable Nearby Interaction to provide the same Precision Finding capabilities present in AirTag.

abstract.text: The object that manages the major tasks associated with every AR experience, such as motion tracking, camera passthrough, and image analysis.
Communicate with Bluetooth low energy and BR/EDR (“Classic”) Devices.
Locate and interact with nearby devices using identifiers, distance, and direction.
An abstract base class for interaction configurations.
A configuration that enables interaction between iPhone and third-party accessories.
An identifier for the accessory in a session.
Creates a configuration for an accessory with the given Bluetooth peer identifier.
Creates a configuration for interaction between iPhone and third-party accessories.
A Boolean value that combines the spatial awareness of ARKit with Nearby Interaction to improve the accuracy of a nearby object’s position.
The distance from the user’s device to the peer device in meters.
An object that identifies a unique connection between two peer devices.
An object that the framework notifies of session events.
Starts a session with a nearby peer.
Provides the framework with an existing AR session to use for Camera Assistance.
Provides configuration data to share with a third-party accessory.
Notifies you when the session updates nearby objects.
Extend your app’s direction finding capabilities with data from Ultra Wideband devices.

doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/docume.title: Extending advanced direction finding and ranging

abstract.text: Establish a connection with a nearby accessory to receive periodic measurements of its distance from the user.

doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/docume.title: Implementing spatial interactions with third-party accessories

abstract.text: Measure the relative position of a nearby device and coach the user to sustain interaction.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
